text:
The documentation of DocumentFragment states that it acts like a lightweight
document, allowing the user to "cut" a bunch of nodes from one Document and
"paste" it into another. When I tried this, I got a DOM Wrong Document exception.

It looks like the top of the DocumentFragment is checked to see if it's a
document fragment, but its children don't have their owner document reset to the
new document.

Demonstration file attached.

text:
BTW, the reason I set the severity of this bug and that of the cloneNode bug,
5293, to Blocker is that without this functionality, I'm not sure there is any
way of copying a set of nodes from one document to another.

See the DOM specification; that is NOT what DocumentFragment does. It's just a 
convenient place to hand other nodes -- effectively, an anonymous element -- 
while processing a _single_ document, with the convenience that if you try to 
insert it as a child of a node belonging to that document what really happens is 
that its children are inserted.

To move data from one document to another, see the DOM Level 2 importNode 
method.

For detailed discussion, see http://www.w3.org/DOM/faq.html#ownerdoc
